poem:
Title: Distant Thunder

Unseen, the silent storm,
Russia's ravening shadow near Kharkiv
and the west-- a cardinal's call
in the wintered woods.

Tens of thousands-- a lustful spring,
facts littered, like autumn leaves,
Underneath, the soil of Ukraine weeps.

Oh, the world's ceaseless kiss
tastes bitter as senseless war.
When will we savor the sweetness of peace?
